New Records: Victor Wembanyama became the fourth-youngest player to score 50 points in a game, trailing only Brandon Jennings, LeBron James, and Devin Booker.
Key Match Events: Wembanyama started quickly against the Wizards, draining three-pointers from 25 and 28 feet as the Spurs raced to a 13-3 lead.
Stuck at 48 points, Wembanyama made an 18-foot jumper for his 49th and 50th points with 8:49 remaining to give San Antonio a 115-98 lead.
Post-Match Reflections: Wembanyama is the first player in league history with 20 three-pointers and 25 blocks over a six-game span.
The Spurs host Los Angeles Lakers on Friday night in the final game of a five-game homestand. They are at Atlanta on Friday night to close a five-game trip.
